p.s: The given speech on the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges was presented by president Barack Obama when he visited ana Universityuniversity in Tophane in Istanbul, Turkey on April 7th of 2009.
His intention with this speech for the students was, that he wanted to encourage them to take part in intercultural exchanges.
ObamasObama's speech is devideddivided into four sections.
The first one is about the reason why he came to Turkey.
It is important for him to rebuild the relationship between the US and the Muslim people and that goes along with mutual respect and interest (l. 1-3).
Next the president goes on with mentioning the importance of young people who are world-opened.
He notices a new spirit of activism and responsibility taking root (l. 7) by looking at all the young Americans who decided to teach in their schools and volunteer abroad (l. 5).
Also in his own presidential campaign he sees young people who provide the energy and idealism that made effort possible (l. 6-7).
Obama says that everywhere he goes he finds young people who are passionate, engaged and informed about what is going on in the world (l. 8) and he is really proud of that.

Furthermore the president mentions that he would like to find new ways to bring young Americans and young people all around the world together by supporting opportunities to learn other languages, serve and study, welcoming students of other countries to their shores (l. 9-11).
He wants to improve how America engages the world (l. 11-12).
The third paragraph of the president's speech is about what can get achieved by exchanges.
Obamatalkestalks about breaking down walls, people coming together, speaking to each other and sharing common experiences, then their common humanity is revealed (l. 13-14).
He reminds that all are joined together by pursuits of a life that is productive and purposeful.
When this happens mistrust will begin to fade and the things we share will become more important than the differences between us (l. 15-17).
In the last part of his speech Obama talks to every single person.
He says the world will be what you make of it (l. 18).
Furthermore he mentions how this can get achieved and the end of his speech is that he says everyone will find a partner, supporter and friend in the USA (l. 21-22).
